channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [HADOOP-12415] hdfs and nfs builds broken on -missing compile-time dependency on netty
item.description: As discovered in BIGTOP-2049 hadoop-nfs module compilation is broken. Looks like that HADOOP-11489 is the root-cause of it.
item.environment: Bigtop, plain Linux distro of any kind
item.summary: hdfs and nfs builds broken on -missing compile-time dependency on netty

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.

comments.comment: A fix is proposed here
..Konstantin, can you attach the patch here for Hadoop's jenkins test run to look at?
steve_l patch attached

-1 overall



Vote Subsystem Runtime Comment
0 pre-patch 15m 32s Pre-patch trunk compilation is healthy.
+1 @author 0m 0s The patch does not contain any @author tags.
-1 tests included 0m 0s The patch doesn't appear to include any new or modified tests. Please justify why no new tests are needed for this patch. Also please list what manual steps were performed to verify this patch.
+1 javac 7m 52s There were no new javac warning messages.
+1 javadoc 10m 8s There were no new javadoc warning messages.
+1 release audit 0m 25s The applied patch does not increase the total number of release audit warnings.
+1 whitespace 0m 0s The patch has no lines that end in whitespace.
+1 install 1m 27s mvn install still works.
+1 eclipse:eclipse 0m 31s The patch built with eclipse:eclipse.
+1 common tests 22m 58s Tests passed in hadoop-common.
    58m 57s

git revision trunk / bf2f2b4
hadoop-common test log https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-HADOOP-Build/7669/artifact/patchprocess/testrun_hadoop-common.txt
Test Results https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-HADOOP-Build/7669/testReport/
Java 1.7.0_55
uname Linux asf902.gq1.ygridcore.net 3.13.0-36-lowlatency #63-Ubuntu SMP PREEMPT Wed Sep 3 21:56:12 UTC 2014 x86_64 x86_64 x86_64 GNU/Linux
Console output https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-HADOOP-Build/7669/console

This message was automatically generated.
steve_l the patch is to the hadoop common pom file, no new tests needed, as long as existing tests pass.

I don't want to add a new "compile" scope JAR to hadoop-common, as it only causes classpath pain downstream.

If this is just for hadoop-nfs module, then shouldn't it go in there? As it will be needed at runtime, presumably
It wasn't enough to just add it to hadoop-nfs, hadoop-hdfs will still fail, that's why I move it up to hadoop-common. We verified it's working for BIGTOP-2049

Adding the io.netty dependency to only hadoop-nfs gets the following failure:
...
[INFO] Apache Hadoop Common ............................... SUCCESS [01:37 min]
[INFO] Apache Hadoop NFS .................................. SUCCESS [ 7.346 s]
[INFO] Apache Hadoop KMS .................................. SUCCESS [ 17.295 s]
[INFO] Apache Hadoop Common Project ....................... SUCCESS [ 0.135 s]
[INFO] Apache Hadoop HDFS ................................. FAILURE [ 29.510 s]
[INFO] Apache Hadoop HttpFS ............................... SKIPPED

+1 the patch looks correct and the placement of the dependency is right. If anything HADOOP-11489 has introduced the bug. I will commit this in a bit to the trunk and branch-2. Thanks for the patch, tomzeng!

-1 for now, please hold off on committing Cos. I'd like to spend some more time figuring out what's happening, because we need to be super careful about adding deps to hadoop-common.

hadoop-nfs builds with current trunk for me and I assume Hadoop precommit since it passed on HADOOP-11489. Do we know why exactly it doesn't work for Bigtop? Also if this was broken by HADOOP-11489, why isn't the fix simply reverting HADOOP-11489?

Andrew, please follow the discussion over here BIGTOP-2049. test-patch isn't really the golden standard when it comes to the testing of the depedency-related changes, as it most likely has pre-populated maven cache.

Hey Cos, I just tried running some mvn commands like this for a fresh cache, build still worked:

cd hadoop-common-project/hadoop-nfs
mvn clean package -DskipTests -Dmaven.repo.local=/tmp/hadoop-12415-hadoop-nfs/

cd hadoop-hdfs-project/hadoop-hdfs-nfs
mvn clean package -DskipTests -Dmaven.repo.local=/tmp/hadoop-12415/

Could you post some standalone steps to reproduce this issue?
andrew.wang can you checkout branch-2.7.1 and build Zookeeper first and then Hadoop?
And build at the top level, I can reproduce it every time (within or outside of Bigtop build).

I'm a -1 too, as I don't want to add things to hadoop-common's dependencies, not when they should be server-side only.

HDFS does import netty-all, so why HDFS is failing to build here is odd. That said, we do appear to be referencing > 1 netty library in hadoop-project:

      <dependency>
        <groupId>io.netty</groupId>
        <artifactId>netty</artifactId>
        <version>3.6.2.Final</version>
      </dependency>

      <dependency>
        <groupId>io.netty</groupId>
        <artifactId>netty-all</artifactId>
        <version>4.1.0.Beta5</version>
      </dependency>

this looks "odd"

tomzeng -are you using a later/private ZK build? Maybe that's the problem: hadoop has been picking up netty from there, and if it changes its dependencies, then things stop.

If so, we should fix hadoop-hdfs and hadoop-nfs, not common, because anything in common ends up the classpath of everything downstream, client or server-side

Right, I note that in the hadoop-common/pom.xml we do some excludes related to ZK and netty, it could be related to that?

<dependency>
      <groupId>org.apache.zookeeper</groupId>
      <artifactId>zookeeper</artifactId>
      <exclusions>
...
        <exclusion>
          <groupId>org.jboss.netty</groupId>
          <artifactId>netty</artifactId>
        </exclusion>
...
    </dependency>
Might be a red-herring, because we surely didn't observe the problem in 2.6 and this exclusion has been sitting in for 2+ years.

Yeah, that didn't seem to be the cause, removing the exclusion didn't work. I found that adding the io.netty dependency in both the hadoop-common/hadoop-nfs pom and the hadoop-hdfs pom worked. And in hadoop-hdfs both io.netty and io.netty-all are needed, kinda odd. If you guys think this is better (does not change hadoop-common), I will go ahead and submit a patch for it.
Tom. yes, please do it for hdfs and nfs -and for hdfs tag as provided. That way it stays off the client classpaths, which is the source of most of the transitive suffering

Steve, the bug isn't Bigtop specific. As any other integration bug it is easily found with bigtop, but one can run the build from 2.7.1 release and step on the same issue. Hence, renaming the bug again.
OK...I wasn't blaming bigtop, just emphasising that the likely cause was the integration building picking up different published ZK dependencies.
Don't worry - I haven't said anything about 'blaming'. I simply stated that the issue can be reproduced in any environment.
New patch, update hadoop-common-project/hadoop-nfs/pom.xml and /hadoop-hdfs-project/hadoop-hdfs/pom.xml instead of hadoop-common pom
steve_l new patch attached that updates hadoop-nfs and hadoop-hdfs instead of hadoop-common pom.

-1 overall

Kos, target 2.7.3 rather than 2.7.2 if you can ... only critical issues should be going into 2.7.2 at this stage.

Steve, arguably this is critical because the build is broken when ran from a clean slate. I don't mind one way or another, as we just patched the Hadoop in the Bigtop stack, but ppl using it directly from the release artifacts would be affected.
check with vinod then

How can we reproduce this from our end? I am surprised that HADOOP-11489 sneaked through without any of us catching through the numerous builds that happened during the release, jenkins etc.

The patch seems to not to be on point though - HADOOP-11489 only removed the dependency from hadoop-nfs and this patch is adding it all the way up into hadoop-common and hadoop-hdfs. Shouldn't the patch be simply a revert of HADOOP-11489?

Overall, we can include the right fix for this JIRA in 2.7.2 as I am still stuck on a couple of HDFS patches.

The way to reproduce it is described in the JIRA - just look through the comments, it should be close to the top.
The reason we didn't simply reverted HADOOP-11489 is because the current fix presents a cleaner solution. Besides, Steve asked to make it more fine-grained in here

Vinod: it happens because some changes upstream haven't been picked up in Hadoop's dependencies: it works with the stock dependency set, but not when we've moved on. So it will surface.

I proposed keeping it out of reverting the change as it was part of the ongoing split to isolate client and server side code. These patches make sure netty is in there server-side

If you're happy with it going in to 2.7.2, then Konstantin; +1 from me
Merged this into branch-2.7, branch-2.7.2 per our discussion above.
